topic.title: Masthead
topic.section: There are two methods the Press Manager can use to define the Masthead for the press, which appears in the Editorial Team page under About the Press: using assigned editorial roles, and creating custom editorial team titles.

section.title: Generating The Editorial Team Using Assigned Editorial Roles

topic.section: When this option is selected, the Editorial Team information in About the Press will be automatically generated using the editorial roles defined in the Press Manager's Roles pages. Users registered as Editors, Acquisitions Editors, Layout Editors, Copyeditors, and Proofreaders will be listed.

section.title: Generating The Editorial Team Using Custom Editorial Team Titles

topic.section:
If a Press Manager wishes to have more control over the information presented in the Editorial Team page under About the Press, they can enable this option from the Masthead page (see Press Management). When this option is enabled, the various titles created under the Masthead page will be used to generate public Editorial Team information as well as information about other people related to the press, if desired.

To create a custom title, the Press Manager clicks on Create Position Title, enters the Title name (ie., Editor in Chief, Acquisitions Editors, Editorial Board, etc.), and decides whether the title will appear under the Editorial Team in About the Press, or just under People in About the Press. The Press Manager can arrange the display order of Editorial Titles on the main Masthead page by using the up and down arrows, and can edit and delete titles if necessary.

To view, add and remove users to a specific title, the Press Manager clicks on the Membership link beside the title name. This will display the current user list for that particular title. The Press Manager can arrange the display order of listed members, and can delete members if necessary. To add a new member, the Press Manager clicks Add Member, and can enroll a user from the list of press members.
